page.title: 07Shopping Pattterns In Hoo.
page.content: Since 1960, new shops providing basic daily provisions have been built both in the village centre and in the new housing estates. Car parking next to these shops is available. The villagers depend very heavily on the bigger centres in Gravesend and the Medway Towns for the purchase of higher order goods with access to them by bus or private car. Large supermarkets in Strood and the {hypermarket}at Hempstead Valley near the M2 are very popular providing excellent parking facilities.{Farm {shops}selling fresh produce have become popular in recent years and {garages}provide an increasingly wide range of goods. Car ownership and the growing mobility of the population is considerably affecting{shopping} patterns.
